benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

covered: Valid Request: Multiple successful retrieval scenarios (both params, only subscriptionId, only requestedDate, no params) cover expected 200 responses and content type.
Empty Response / No Data: TC13 covers behavior when the DB contains no subscriptions/price lists (404 or empty/default response).
Query Parameters: Many combinations of valid/invalid parameters are tested (omitted, malformed, partial, extra unexpected parameters).

Parameter validation & error handling: Invalid subscriptionId format (TC05), non-existent subscriptionId (TC06), invalid requestedDate format (TC07), malformed/partial parameter values (TC19) are present.
Authorization & auth failure: Unauthorized access is covered (TC08) to check 401 handling.
Dependency & service error handling: Service unavailable (TC09), dependent catalog service unavailable (TC20) cover 503/502 scenarios.
Security: Injection (TC10) and XSS (TC22) attempts are included, ensuring attacks are rejected without leaking internals.
Edge cases & regression: Date boundary regression (TC21) and large change history (TC18) are present.
Performance & resilience: Response time under normal and peak load (TC14/TC15), retry after transient network failure (TC17) are covered.
Robustness: Large query parameter payload (TC11), extra unexpected parameters (TC12), empty DB (TC13) and accessibility (TC23) are included.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination parameters or behavior (offset/limit/page) or verifying correct slicing of results, or how large result sets are paginated. TC18 tests large volume but not pagination mechanics.
Caching behavior / Conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) or 304 Not Modified responses.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting behavior (429 Too Many Requests) or client throttling under continuous bursts.
Authorization nuance & scopes: Only 401 (missing/invalid token) is covered. Tests for 403 (forbidden / insufficient scope/role) are missing.

Schema-level validation: While tests assert "valid PriceList JSON object", there are no explicit tests validating the response against the canonical PriceList schema (field-level presence, types, required/optional fields, numeric formats).
Server error coverage: There is no explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error or graceful degradation/logging when backend failures (other than dependency 502/503) occur.
Response headers & content-negotiation: Aside from content-type, headers like Content-Length, Cache-Control, ETag, Vary, and Accept negotiation are not covered.
Pagination-related performance: Large-data performance is tested, but not behavior of paginated endpoints under load (combined pagination + performance).
URL encoding / character-encoding edge cases: Tests do not cover percent-encoding or unusual but legal characters in query parameters beyond injection/XSS cases.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include limit/offset/page parameters, boundary values (0, 1, max), and verify correct slicing and metadata (total, next/prev links) where applicable.
Add caching and conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since flows and 304 responses, and ensure stale/weak ETag handling.
Implement rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header, and client backoff behavior.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 Forbidden cases for insufficient scopes/roles, and role-based access tests if API restricts certain clients.
Add strict schema validation tests: validate response JSON against the PriceList specification (#/definitions/PriceList), checking required fields, types, currencies, and numeric precision.
Add server-error and resilience tests: simulate internal failures to ensure 500 responses are handled and error messages do not leak internals; verify fallback behavior if applicable.
Verify response headers and content negotiation: assert Content-Type, Content-Length, Cache-Control, ETag, Vary; test Accept header handling and behavior for non-application/json Accept values.
Add tests for pagination + performance under load: ensure acceptable response times when paginating large datasets.
Add URL/encoding edge-case tests: percent-encoded characters, very long URLs beyond practical limits (complementing TC11), and internationalized characters in query values.
